Articles.Content:
Finally managed to land my goliath mun base!!

It consists of 4 habitat modules and a power station with additional solar arrays just incase each habitat is also fun so the kerbels dont get lonely

Hopefully build my base around this

so far

4 habitats: 60

1 power station: 15

Mun: 10

Total: 85
Are you able to get opt out clause more than once on different planets
This may be a stupid question, but can you transfer the fuel out of the HOME admin module without docking on it? if so how? please help!

Opt Out Clause is planet-wide. (And seeing as you can only have one unified colony per planet, also planet-wide.) If any of your Kerbals can't get home to Kerbin from the body in question, you lose your claim to it.

Fuel transfer without docking can be done with a few mods. I listed two in the first topic: Merlin Transfer System and Quantum Fuel System.
Personally, my favorite mod for fuel transfer is the latest version of KAS, which is what I have on my Minmus kethane crawler.
cheers guys will check them out
okay so if I have a vehicle per site I can have multiple sites 2.5km apart so I don't run into the loading issues.

okay so if I have a vehicle per site I can have multiple sites 2.5km apart so I don't run into the loading issues.

That was my intention when I came up with the various rules involving sites, yes.

Someone wants at the top of the leaderboards!

EDIT: Be thankful I'm not taking part in this one, incidentally.

During the previous run, I made a 24-site colony.

Each site was comprised of a setup very similar to this. A part of me hopes that someone actually tries to top that bit of insanity of mine at some point. (P.S. By my reckoning, the score on this colony when you account for the Kethane mining site is 1544. Scary!)

Finally! Some competition!! I was starting to get tired of sitting at the top of the leaderboard with no-one even close.

Therefore, I will post a new base, my first Eeloo colony, Eos.

And while I'm at it, it's about time I showed you a picture of my main lifter.

It gets the hab module on top as far as Dres or Eve normally, but if refueled in orbit can go as far as Moho or Eeloo.

My score:

Eos: Eeloo(120)

- 1 Habitat Module (15)

- 2 Kerbals (2)

- 1 Site (10)

Subtotal: 147

Other Bases:

Artemis: 137

Aphrodite: 74

Hermes: 117

Ares: 62

Hestia: 87

Poseidon: 117

Demeter: 102

Grand Total: 1009

Time to get busy and Colonize!

Erm, I may have to add a contingency that colonies need to land upright. Otherwise, those poor Dres-bound Kerbals... Fortunately Dres has low enough gravity that you should be able to get that thing upright... right?

Finally! Some competition!! I was starting to get tired of sitting at the top of the leaderboard with no-one even close.

Therefore, I will post a new base, my first Eeloo colony, Eos.

And while I'm at it, it's about time I showed you a picture of my main lifter.

It gets the hab module on top as far as Dres or Eve normally, but if refueled in orbit can go as far as Moho or Eeloo.

What mod are the big fuel tanks on?

What mod are the big fuel tanks on?

They're from KW rocketry.

And, new colonies!!

Ike colony Athena,

Bop colony Dionysus,

and Vall colony Hera,

- Eve: Aphrodite (74)

- Moho: Hermes (117)

- Laythe: Poseidon (117)

- Dres: Hestia (87)

- Eeloo: Eos (147)

Grand Total: 1290

Back on top!

And 2 planets away from the Master of the Kerbalverse! I have to admit, I didn't think anyone would actually get this far on that one. That said, Tylo and especially Jool are the toughest candidates for colonizing. Best of luck!
